description: Conversion of office into 5 self-contained flats (2 one bedroom and 3 two bedroom), single storey extension to rear, external alterations involving the removal of the existing replacement UPVc windows and reinstatement with new timber frame double glazed sash windows, and landscaping
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used in the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matter which have been given in this application.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1 B5, B21, B24 and B24a; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5. | Dustbin and enclosed refuse area, details of which shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, shall be sited a maximum distance of 23 metres (10 metres where paladins are employed) from an adopted highway, and a maximum of 25 metres from any dwelling unit intended to use them. Such details as approved shall be implemented before first occupation of the development and thereafter retained.  Reason: To comply with the Council's Design Guides, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5 & H34; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscape works to include details of access to garden area for each of the proposed units, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the phased programme agrees by the local planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.    Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B2, ES4 and H26; Replacement UDP policies 4.2, 4.5 and 5.5. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B5, B8, ES5; Replacement UDP policies 4.1 and 4.11. | The development will be affected by mixed transport noise of traffic and aircraft at a level which falls into Category B/C noise exposure. Prior to the commencement of development, details shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority for mitigation works to protect sensitive rooms from external noise. The criteria to be met and the assessment method shall be that specified at Document 5.3 "Guidance for Developers". The details shall also include alternative means for ventilation for noise sensitive rooms, meeting the said criteria. The works as approved shall be completed before first occupation and thereafter be retained form the life of the building.  REASON: To prevent nuisance to the occupants in accordance with UDP policy ES5 and Replacement UDP policy 4.11. | Details of access for people with disabilities shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority before any work is commenced; and the approved scheme shall be implemented before the first occupation of residential accommodation, and shall be permanently retained.   Reason: To ensure adequate provision for people with disabilities, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B6, ES3, H12; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3. | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected and shall ensure that sightlines of 1.5m by 1.5m and there are no obstructions to visibility above 0.6m high. The details as approved shall be completed before the residential units are first occupied and permanently retained.   Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers and in the interests of highway and pedestrian safety, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1, B5, B20, B21, B24, B24a and ES2; Replacement UDP policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and retained permanently.   Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies B1 and T15; Replacement UDP policy 9.6. | Details of Mechanical Ventilator units must have at least two different airflow setting and the self noise at highest setting must be less than 40 dB(A) a the highest setting and less than 35 dB(A) at the lowest setting. Such details as approved shall be implemted prior to first occupation of the units hereby approved and retained thereafter.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future and existing nearby occupiers, in accordance with the Council's adopted UDP policies; Replacement UDP policies  .
